intro: Achroanthes umbellulata, commonly known as the yellow sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clustered umbels, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its drought tolerance, it is well adapted to arid environments.
